issue.title: Create a materials tag for collision bodies analogous to visual materials

content.raw:
What might also be nice in the long run is a material texture that specifies the material properties at a specific point on the model but idk whether that's feasible for real-time purposes. 

For example when you have a hammer you could assign steel and rubber for different parts of the model without having to take it into pieces. Using this approach it might also allow for dynamic changes in material properties at run time caused by interaction with other objects / degeneration of material / environmental effects / etc. ... for example when you put your hammer into a pot of paint the part that was in contact with the paint would become very slippery. It would also allow for easier/more realistic simulation of rain, black ice, etc. and it would allow for more precise control over material properties (e.g. have spots of dry road and spots of mud ... when assigning one material per link this would require taking the model apart into different pieces).
